posts.name: Adam
posts.cooked: We cannot fix this error, we’ve tried updating the firmware and recalibrating to no effect. Please help

posts.name: Chris Gerth
posts.cooked:
image 780×861 114 KB It would appear you are still in calibration mode.

image 780×861 114 KB

image 780×861 114 KB

source

posts.name: Adam
posts.cooked: How do I take it out of calibration mode?

posts.name: Jacob Caporuscio
posts.cooked:
lol:

we’ve tried updating the firmware

What firmware version and Phoenix version are you using?

posts.name: Adam
posts.cooked: We are using the most recent firmware from the ctre website

posts.name: Jacob Caporuscio
posts.cooked:
Yes, but specifically what is the name of the firmware file you are using?

There are now two versions of firmware (standard and Pro, which is specified in the file name) and you must use the version that matches the API you are using.

If you have flashed Pro firmware but the device is not licensed, you will see red and green LEDs. Falcon: Simultaneous Red/Green that alternates sides CANcoder: LED will alternate Red/Green

posts.name: Adam
posts.cooked: What’s the difference between the two? (Nvm didn’t read the last part, that’s probably the issue)

posts.name: Jacob Caporuscio
posts.cooked:
One version of firmware is for Phoenix v5, the other is for Phoenix Pro.

See my edit above for why it may be relevant to your situation.

posts.name: Adam
posts.cooked: It works, thanks for the help

posts.name: Roger
posts.cooked: This fixed my issue also.  Thank you for posting this solution!!
